description: From Latin metopa and its source, Koine Greek μετόπη (metópē), from μετά (metá, “between”) +‎ ὀπή (opḗ, “hole”).

entries.meaning: (architecture) The architectural element between two triglyphs in a Doric frieze. [from 16th c.]
examples: There's a second plate of that metope that shows the full figures of both Perseus and Medusa and includes the winged horse Pegasus that was born of Medusa's blood.
